examples.sentence: よかったら - If you'd like

sections.heading: What is たら Conditional?
sections.content:
たら is the most versatile conditional form, expressing hypothetical situations, sequential actions ("when/after"), and discoveries. It's formed from the past tense (た-form) + ら.

雨が降ったら、行きません "If it rains, I won't go" (hypothetical) 家に着いたら、電話してね "When you get home, call me" (sequential) ドアを開けたら、誰もいなかった "When I opened the door, no one was there" (discovery)

children.heading: Pattern: た-form + ら
children.content: | Verb | た-form | + ら | | ------ | ------- | -------- | | 行く | 行った | 行ったら | | 食べる | 食べた | 食べたら | | する | した | したら | | 来る | 来た | 来たら | | 読む | 読んだ | 読んだら | | 書く | 書いた | 書いたら |

children.heading: With adjectives
children.content: い-adjectives: 高い → 高かったら な-adjectives: 静か → 静かだったら Nouns: 雨 → 雨だったら

children.heading: Negative form
children.content: 行かない → 行かなかったら (If (you) don't go) 高くない → 高くなかったら (If it's not expensive)

children.heading: 1. Hypothetical future ("if")
children.content: 明日雨が降ったら、中止です "If it rains tomorrow, it's cancelled" お金があったら、買いたい "If I had money, I'd want to buy it" 時間があったら、遊びに来てね "If you have time, come visit"

children.heading: 2. Sequential actions ("when/after")
children.content: 宿題が終わったら、遊ぼう "When homework is finished, let's play" 駅に着いたら、電話してください "When you arrive at the station, please call" ご飯を食べたら、出かけます "After eating, I'll go out"

children.heading: 3. Discovery/unexpected result
children.content: 家に帰ったら、猫が寝ていた "When I got home, the cat was sleeping" 窓を開けたら、雪が降っていた "When I opened the window, it was snowing" 財布を見たら、お金がなかった "When I checked my wallet, there was no money"

children.heading: Hypothetical conditions
children.content: 暇だったら、手伝ってください "If you're free, please help" 分からなかったら、聞いてね "If you don't understand, ask me" よかったら、一緒に行きませんか "If you'd like, won't you go together?"

children.heading: After completion
children.content: 仕事が終わったら、飲みに行こう "When work is done, let's go drinking" 春になったら、桜を見に行きたい "When spring comes, I want to go see cherry blossoms" 大人になったら、何になりたい？ "When you become an adult, what do you want to be?"

children.heading: Most versatile conditional
children.content: Can use with: ✓ Commands/requests ✓ Volitional (~よう) ✓ Past tense results ✓ Desires (~たい) ✓ Any sentence type Most flexible!

children.heading: Works in all contexts
children.content: Can replace other conditionals in most situations: 安いと買う → 安かったら買う ✓ 安ければ買う → 安かったら買う ✓ When in doubt, use たら!

children.heading: Example 1: Making Plans
children.content: A: 週末、何する？ "What are you doing this weekend?" B: 天気がよかったら、ピクニックに行きたいな "If the weather's good, I want to go on a picnic" A: いいね！行こう "Sounds good! Let's go"

children.heading: Example 2: Sequential Action
children.content: A: これ、いつ送る？ "When are you sending this?" B: 確認が終わったら、すぐ送るよ "When the check is done, I'll send it right away" A: お願いね "Please do"

children.heading: Example 3: Discovery
children.content: A: 昨日どうだった？ "How was yesterday?" B: パーティーに行ったら、みんな帰ったところだった "When I went to the party, everyone had just left" A: え、残念！ "Oh no, too bad!"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Confusing with past tense
children.content: たら is NOT past tense! 行ったら = "If/when (you) go" (future/hypothetical) 行った = "Went" (past tense) たら looks like past but isn't!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using た twice
children.content: Wrong: 食べたったら ❌ Right: 食べたら ✓ "If/when (you) eat" Don't double the た!

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong form
children.content: Wrong: 食べるたら ❌ Right: 食べたら ✓ "If/when (you) eat" Must use た-form, not dictionary form!

children.heading: たら - Most versatile
children.content: 雨が降ったら、中止 "If it rains, cancelled" Works everywhere Most common in casual speech

children.heading: と - Natural consequence
children.content: 雨が降ると、中止になる "When it rains, it gets cancelled" Habitual/natural only

children.heading: ば - General condition
children.content: 雨が降れば、中止 "If it rains, cancelled" More formal General condition

children.heading: なら - Contextual
children.content: 雨なら、中止だよ "If it's rain, it's cancelled" Based on given info

children.heading: Giving instructions
children.content: 困ったら、電話してください "If you're in trouble, please call" 分からなかったら、聞いてね "If you don't understand, ask me" 準備ができたら、教えてください "When you're ready, please let me know"

children.heading: Counterfactual wishes
children.content: お金があったら、旅行できるのに "If I had money, I could travel" (but I don't) もっと時間があったら、勉強できるのに "If I had more time, I could study" (but I don't) 彼がいたら、楽しいのに "If he were here, it would be fun" (but he isn't)

children.heading: Polite invitation/offer
children.content: よかったら、食べてください "If you'd like, please eat" よかったら、一緒に行きませんか "If you'd like, won't you go together?" よかったら、使ってください "If you'd like, please use it" Very common polite phrase!

children.heading: Step by step instructions
children.content: まず、ここを押したら、次にこれを選んでください "First, when you press here, next please select this" 駅に着いたら、電話してください。 そうしたら、迎えに行きます "When you arrive at the station, please call. Then I'll come pick you up"

children.heading: Past tense + たら for discoveries
children.content: 外を見たら、雪が降っていた "When I looked outside, it was snowing" 冷蔵庫を開けたら、何もなかった "When I opened the fridge, there was nothing" 電話したら、留守番電話だった "When I called, it was voicemail"

children.heading: どうしたら (what if)
children.content: どうしたらいい？ "What should I do?" (lit: If I do what, is it good?) どうしたら痩せられる？ "How can I lose weight?" (lit: If I do what, can I lose weight?)

children.heading: If not / when not
children.content: 分からなかったら、聞いて "If you don't understand, ask" 行かなかったら、連絡してね "If you're not going, let me know" 美味しくなかったら、残していいよ "If it's not delicious, you can leave it"

children.heading: Expressing regret/complaint
children.content: 勉強したら、合格できるのに "If you studied, you could pass" (but you don't) 早く寝たら、元気になるのに "If you slept early, you'd feel better" (but you don't) Shows what could happen but doesn't

children.heading: Temporal conditions
children.content: 夏になったら、海に行きたい "When summer comes, I want to go to the beach" 20歳になったら、お酒が飲める "When you turn 20, you can drink alcohol" 明日になったら、分かる "When tomorrow comes, we'll know"

children.heading: Formal requests
children.content: お時間がありましたら、ご連絡ください "If you have time, please contact me" よろしかったら、こちらをどうぞ "If it's alright, please have this"

children.heading: Multiple conditions
children.content: お金があって、時間があったら、旅行したい "If I have money and time, I want to travel" 雨が止んで、天気がよくなったら、出かけよう "When the rain stops and the weather gets better, let's go out"

children.heading: Basic
children.content: 暇だったら、遊ぼう "If you're free, let's hang out" 終わったら、教えてね "When you're done, let me know" 家に帰ったら、すぐ寝た "When I got home, I immediately slept"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: もし宝くじに当たったら、世界一周旅行がしたい "If I won the lottery, I'd want to travel around the world" 駅に着いたら電話してください。 そうしたら、迎えに行きます "When you arrive at the station, please call. Then I'll come pick you up" 財布を見たら、お金が全然入っていなくて、びっくりした "When I checked my wallet, there was no money at all, and I was surprised"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: もし時間を戻せたら、もっと一生懸命勉強して、 違う道を選んでいたかもしれない。でも、 今の人生も悪くないと思っている。 "If I could turn back time, I might have studied harder and chosen a different path. However, I think my current life isn't bad either." このプロジェクトが成功したら、会社の業績が 大幅に改善されるでしょう。そうなったら、 従業員の待遇も良くなると期待しています。 "If this project succeeds, the company's performance will improve significantly. If that happens, I expect employee treatment will also improve."

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: と conditional - Natural consequence ば conditional - General condition なら conditional - Contextual Conditionals overview - All conditional forms 〜たらどう - How about (advice) よかったら - If you'd like
